 157 -    def commit_hook(self, entropy_repository_instance): 

 158   
 159          const_debug_write(__name__, 
 160              "ServerEntropyRepositoryPlugin: calling commit_hook => %s" % ( 
 161                  self,) 
 162              ) 
 163   
 164          dbs = ServerRepositoryStatus() 
 165          dbfile = self._metadata['local_dbfile'] 
 166          repo = self._metadata['repo_name'] 
 167          read_only = self._metadata['read_only'] 
 168          if read_only: 
 169              # do not taint database 
 170              return 0 
 171   
 172          # taint the database status 
 173          taint_file = self._server.get_local_database_taint_file(repo = repo) 
 174          f = open(taint_file, "w") 
 175          f.write(etpConst['currentarch']+" database tainted\n") 
 176          f.flush() 
 177          f.close() 
 178          const_setup_file(taint_file, etpConst['entropygid'], 0o664) 
 179          dbs.set_tainted(dbfile) 
 180   
 181          if not dbs.is_bumped(dbfile): 
 182              # bump revision, setting DatabaseBump causes 
 183              # the session to just bump once 
 184              dbs.set_bumped(dbfile) 
 185              """ 
 186              Entropy repository revision bumping function. Every time it's called, 
 187              revision is incremented by 1. 
 188              """ 
 189              revision_file = self._server.get_local_database_revision_file( 
 190                  repo = repo) 
 191              if not os.path.isfile(revision_file): 
 192                  revision = 1 
 193              else: 
 194                  with open(revision_file, "r") as rev_f: 
 195                      revision = int(rev_f.readline().strip()) 
 196                      revision += 1 
 197   
 198              tmp_revision_file = revision_file + ".tmp" 
 199              with open(tmp_revision_file, "w") as rev_fw: 
 200                  rev_fw.write(str(revision)+"\n") 
 201                  rev_fw.flush() 
 202              # atomic ! 
 203              os.rename(tmp_revision_file, revision_file) 
 204   
 205          return 0

 388 -    def analyze_server_repo_string(repostring, product = None): 

 389          """ 
 390          Analyze a server repository string (usually contained in server.conf), 
 391          extracting all the parameters. 
 392   
 393          @param repostring: repository string 
 394          @type repostring: string 
 395          @keyword product: system product which repository belongs to 
 396          @rtype: None 
 397          @return: None 
 398          """ 
 399   
 400          if product == None: 
 401              product = etpConst['product'] 
 402   
 403          mydata = {} 
 404          repoid = repostring.split("|")[1].strip() 
 405          repodesc = repostring.split("|")[2].strip() 
 406          repouris = repostring.split("|")[3].strip() 
 407   
 408          service_url = None 
 409          eapi3_port = etpConst['socket_service']['port'] 
 410          eapi3_ssl_port = etpConst['socket_service']['ssl_port'] 
 411          if len(repostring.split("|")) > 4: 
 412              service_url = repostring.split("|")[4].strip() 
 413   
 414              eapi3_formatcolon = service_url.rfind("#") 
 415              if eapi3_formatcolon != -1: 
 416                  try: 
 417                      ports = service_url[eapi3_formatcolon+1:].split(",") 
 418                      eapi3_port = int(ports[0]) 
 419                      if len(ports) > 1: 
 420                          eapi3_ssl_port = int(ports[1]) 
 421                      service_url = service_url[:eapi3_formatcolon] 
 422                  except (ValueError, IndexError,): 
 423                      eapi3_port = etpConst['socket_service']['port'] 
 424                      eapi3_ssl_port = etpConst['socket_service']['ssl_port'] 
 425   
 426          mydata = {} 
 427          mydata['repoid'] = repoid 
 428          mydata['description'] = repodesc 
 429          mydata['mirrors'] = [] 
 430          mydata['community'] = False 
 431          mydata['service_url'] = service_url 
 432          mydata['service_port'] = eapi3_port 
 433          mydata['ssl_service_port'] = eapi3_ssl_port 
 434          uris = repouris.split() 
 435          for uri in uris: 
 436              mydata['mirrors'].append(uri) 
 437   
 438          return repoid, mydata
